hero.title: Cultivating Connections, Harvesting Prosperity
hero.subtitle: We're on a mission to digitize and connect the global agricultural supply chain, empowering every stakeholder from soil to shelf.

vision.title: Our Vision for a Connected Future
vision.p1: DamDoh was born from a simple yet powerful idea: that technology can bridge the gaps in the agricultural world. We envision a world where smallholder farmers have direct access to global markets, where buyers can source produce with verifiable confidence, and where knowledge flows freely to create a more sustainable and equitable food system.
vision.p2: We are more than a platform; we are a community dedicated to solving real-world challenges with innovative, user-centric solutions.

challenge.title: The Fragmented Landscape of Agriculture
challenge.description: The agricultural supply chain is a complex and often disconnected ecosystem, presenting numerous challenges for everyone involved.
details: Smallholder farmers struggle to connect with larger, more profitable markets.
Poor coordination leads to high costs and significant post-harvest losses.
Lack of formal records bars access to credit, loans, and insurance.
Farmers lack access to modern techniques and real-time market data.
Buyers face uncertainty about the quality, origin, and farming practices of produce.
Increasing unpredictability requires more resilient farming systems.
A significant portion of food is lost between the farm and the consumer.
Siloed information prevents a holistic view of the supply chain.

solution.title: The DamDoh Solution: An Integrated Ecosystem
solution.description: We address these challenges by providing a single, unified platform with tools for everyone.

p2p.title: Peer-to-Peer
p2p.content: Farmers connecting with other farmers to share knowledge and form cooperatives.

p2b.title: Producer-to-Business
p2b.content: Direct links between farmers and buyers, processors, and exporters, cutting out unnecessary middlemen.

p2e.title: Producer-to-Expert
p2e.content: Access to agronomists, financial advisors, and logistics providers to improve operations.

p2w.title: Producer-to-World
p2w.content: Enabling smallholder farmers to participate in the global marketplace with confidence and transparency.

commitment.title: Join Our Growing Ecosystem
commitment.p1: Our commitment is to the people who feed the world. We believe that by providing the digital tools they need, we can foster a more resilient, profitable, and sustainable agricultural sector for generations to come.
commitment.p2: Whether you're planting a seed, buying in bulk, or financing a farm, you have a place in the DamDoh community.

careers.title: Careers at DamDoh
careers.subtitle: Join our team and help build the future of agriculture.

whyWorkWithUs.title: Why Work With Us?
whyWorkWithUs.intro: At DamDoh, you'll be part of a passionate, mission-driven team dedicated to making a real-world impact. We offer:
whyWorkWithUs.point1: A collaborative and innovative work environment.
whyWorkWithUs.point2: The opportunity to solve complex challenges in a global industry.
whyWorkWithUs.point5: A culture of continuous learning and professional growth.

job1.title: Senior Frontend Engineer (Next.js)
job1.description: We're looking for an experienced Next.js developer to lead the development of our user-facing applications. You'll work with modern technologies to build a fast, scalable, and intuitive platform.

job2.title: AI/ML Engineer - Genkit Specialist
job2.description: Join our AI team to build and deploy intelligent features using Genkit and Google's AI stack. You will work on projects like crop diagnosis, market prediction, and intelligent matching.

job3.title: Head of Partnerships - AgriBusiness
job3.description: Lead our efforts to build strategic partnerships with key players in the agricultural ecosystem, including financial institutions, NGOs, and government agencies.

noOpenings.title: No Openings Right Now
noOpenings.content1: We're always looking for talented individuals passionate about our mission. If you don't see a role that fits, feel free to send your resume and a cover letter to

communityGuidelines.title: Community Guidelines
communityGuidelines.subtitle: Fostering a professional, respectful, and collaborative environment.
communityGuidelines.intro: Welcome to the DamDoh community! Our mission is to connect the global agricultural supply chain. To ensure a positive and productive experience for everyone, we ask all members to adhere to the following guidelines.

respectful.title: Be Respectful and Professional
respectful.description: Treat all members with respect, even when you disagree. Harassment, hate speech, and personal attacks will not be tolerated. Maintain a professional tone suitable for a global business network.

authentic.title: Be Authentic and Honest
authentic.description: Represent yourself and your business accurately. Do not misrepresent your products, services, or certifications. Authenticity is the foundation of trust on our platform.

relevant.title: Stay On-Topic and Constructive
relevant.description: Keep your posts and comments relevant to the forum or discussion topic. Share knowledge, ask thoughtful questions, and provide constructive feedback. Spam, self-promotion outside of designated areas, and irrelevant content may be removed.

fairTrade.title: Promote Fair Trade Practices
fairTrade.description: Engage in fair and ethical business practices. Negotiate in good faith, fulfill your commitments, and communicate clearly and honestly in all transactions and interactions.

sustainable.title: Encourage Sustainability
sustainable.description: We are a platform dedicated to improving the agricultural ecosystem. We encourage discussions and practices that promote environmental sustainability, soil health, and long-term ecological balance.

reporting.title: Reporting Violations
reporting.content: If you see content or behavior that violates these guidelines, please report it to our team at {emailLink}. We are committed to maintaining a safe and professional community.

communityGuidelines.conclusion: Thank you for being a part of the DamDoh community and helping us build a better future for agriculture.

contactPage.title: Contact Us
contactPage.subtitle: We'd love to hear from you. Here's how you can reach our team.

industryNewsPage.title: Industry News
industryNewsPage.description: Stay informed with the latest trends, research, and policy updates in global agriculture.

news1.title: Global Grain Prices Surge Amidst Weather Concerns in Key Exporting Regions
news1.excerpt: Wheat and corn futures have seen a significant increase this week as drought conditions in North America and excessive rain in South America raise concerns about future supply.

news2.title: EU Implements Stricter Regulations on Sustainable Packaging for Food Imports
news2.excerpt: A new set of regulations effective January 1st will require all food products imported into the European Union to meet stringent new standards for recyclable and compostable packaging.

news3.title: Study Shows Regenerative Agriculture Practices Can Boost Farm Profitability by 20%
news3.excerpt: A five-year study published in 'Nature Food' demonstrates that farms adopting regenerative practices like no-till and cover cropping saw increased profitability and soil health.

noNews.title: No News Articles Found
noNews.description: There are currently no news articles matching your search or filter criteria. Check back soon for the latest updates.

termsOfService.title: Terms of Service
termsOfService.introduction: Welcome to DamDoh! These terms and conditions outline the rules and regulations for the use of DamDoh's Website.

agreementToTerms.heading: 1. Agreement to Terms
agreementToTerms.content: By accessing this website we assume you accept these terms and conditions. Do not continue to use DamDoh if you do not agree to take all of the terms and conditions stated on this page.

intellectualProperty.heading: 2. Intellectual Property Rights
intellectualProperty.content: Other than the content you own, under these Terms, DamDoh and/or its licensors own all the intellectual property rights and materials contained in this Website.

userRepresentations.heading: 3. User Representations
userRepresentations.content: By using the Site, you represent and warrant that: (1) all registration information you submit will be true, accurate, current, and complete; (2) you will maintain the accuracy of such information and promptly update such registration information as necessary...

prohibitedActivities.heading: 4. Prohibited Activities
prohibitedActivities.content: You may not access or use the Site for any purpose other than that for which we make the Site available. The Site may not be used in connection with any commercial endeavors except those that are specifically endorsed or approved by us.

platformManagement.heading: 5. Platform Management
platformManagement.content: We reserve the right, but not the obligation, to: (1) monitor the Site for violations of these Terms of Use; (2) take appropriate legal action against anyone who, in our sole discretion, violates the law or these Terms of Use...

termAndTermination.heading: 6. Term and Termination
termAndTermination.content: These Terms of Use shall remain in full force and effect while you use the Site. WITHOUT LIMITING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THESE TERMS OF USE, WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO, IN OUR SOLE DISCRETION AND WITHOUT NOTICE OR LIABILITY, DENY ACCESS TO AND USE OF THE SITE...

modificationsAndInterruptions.heading: 7. Modifications and Interruptions
modificationsAndInterruptions.content: We reserve the right to change, modify, or remove the contents of the Site at any time or for any reason at our sole discretion without notice. We also reserve the right to modify or discontinue all or part of the Site without notice at any time.

governingLaw.heading: 8. Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms shall be governed by and defined following the laws of Kenya. DamDoh and yourself irrevocably consent that the courts of Kenya shall have exclusive jurisdiction to resolve any dispute which may arise in connection with these terms.

disputeResolution.heading: 9. Dispute Resolution
disputeResolution.content: Any dispute arising out of or in connection with this contract, including any question regarding its existence, validity, or termination, shall be referred to and finally resolved by the International Commercial Arbitration Court under the European Arbitration Chamber.

contactUs.heading: 10. Contact Us
contactUs.content: In order to resolve a complaint regarding the Site or to receive further information regarding use of the Site, please contact us.

termsOfService.conclusion: To resolve a complaint or get more information, please {contactLink}.

fgwGuidePage.title: Farming God's Way Guide
fgwGuidePage.description: A sustainable, no-till, faith-based agricultural solution for the poor.
fgwGuidePage.intro: Farming God's Way (FGW) is not just a technology, but a biblically-based management and technology solution to the agricultural needs of the poor. It's about being faithful stewards of the land God has given us. Below are the core principles.

principles.title: No-Tillage
principles.summary: Protect the soil by not plowing it. This preserves the God-given soil structure.
howTo: Create permanent planting stations (holes) instead of ridges.
Only dig where you are going to plant the seed.
Walk on permanent pathways to avoid compacting your planting soil.
whyItWorks: Prevents soil erosion from wind and water.
Protects soil life and fungal networks.
Dramatically increases water infiltration and retention.
Reduces labor and fuel costs associated with plowing.
principles.imageAlt: A field with no-till planting stations

principles.title: God's Blanket
principles.summary: Keep the soil 100% covered with a thick layer of organic matter, just like in a forest.
howTo: Gather dry organic matter such as grass, straw, dry leaves, or maize stalks.
Apply a thick layer of mulch (at least 10-15cm) over the entire plot.
Never burn your crop residues; use them as mulch.
When planting, make a small opening in the mulch for your seed.
whyItWorks: Saves significant soil moisture, reducing water needs.
Feeds soil life as it decomposes, building rich topsoil.
Protects the soil from the direct heat of the sun.
principles.imageAlt: A field covered with a thick blanket of mulch

principles.title: High Standards
principles.summary: Do everything on time, to a high standard, with no wastage, and with joy.
howTo: Prepare the land well before the first rains.
Plant at the optimal time for your region and crop.
Follow precise measurements for planting depth and spacing.
Manage your resources (seed, inputs, time) wisely to avoid waste.
whyItWorks: Maximizes the genetic potential of the seed.
Ensures the crop gets the full benefit of the early rains.
Leads to higher yields and greater profitability.
principles.imageAlt: A farmer carefully planting seeds in a well-prepared field

knfInputsPage.title: KNF Inputs Assistant
knfInputsPage.description: Create, track, and manage your farmer-made Korean Natural Farming inputs.

recipeData.name: Fermented Plant Juice (FPJ)
recipeData.description: A fermented extract of a plant's sap and chlorophylls. Rich in enzymes and microorganisms, it's a potent growth enhancer for plants.
ingredients: 1kg of fast-growing plant parts (e.g., sweet potato tips, bamboo shoots)
steps: Collect plant materials before sunrise when they are most potent. Do not wash.
Add an equal weight of brown sugar and mix thoroughly.
Pack tightly into a clay pot or glass jar, filling to about 2/3 capacity.
Cover with a breathable cloth and store in a cool, dark place.
Let it ferment for about 7 days.
recipeData.usage: Dilution ratio: 1:500 to 1:1000 with water. Apply as a foliar spray or soil drench.

recipeData.name: Fish Amino Acid (FAA)
recipeData.description: A potent liquid fertilizer made from fish waste, rich in nitrogen and amino acids. Excellent for boosting plant growth.
steps: Chop the fish parts into small pieces.
In a container, layer the fish parts and brown sugar, starting and ending with a layer of sugar.
Fill the container to about 2/3 capacity and cover with a breathable cloth.
Store in a cool, dark place and let it ferment for at least 3-6 months.
recipeData.usage: Dilution ratio: 1:1000 with water. Primarily used as a soil drench.

checkin.description: Use the scanner to check attendees in by scanning the QR code on their ticket.

error.wrongEvent: This ticket is for a different event.
error.noUserId: Could not find a user ID on this ticket.
error.unknown: An unknown error occurred during check-in.
error.failUnknown: Check-in failed for an unknown reason.

scanFail.title: Scan Failed
scanFail.description: Could not read the QR code. Please try again.
